dt: {bc}the act of having or taking into control
{bc}control or occupancy of property without regard to ownership
{bc}an instance of having such control (as in football)
{bc}domination by something (such as an evil spirit, a passion, or an idea)
{bc}a psychological state in which an individual's normal personality is replaced by another

shortdef: the act of having or taking into control
control or occupancy of property without regard to ownership

dt: {bc}control of one's emotions or reactions especially when under stress {bc}{sx|presence of mind||}, {sx|composure||}

pt: {sc}confidence{/sc} {sc}assurance{/sc} {sc}self-possession{/sc} {sc}aplomb{/sc} mean a state of mind or a manner marked by easy coolness and freedom from uncertainty, diffidence, or embarrassment. {sc}confidence{/sc} stresses faith in oneself and one's powers without any suggestion of conceit or arrogance.

pt.t: the {it}confidence{/it} that comes from long experience

pt: {sc}assurance{/sc} carries a stronger implication of certainty and may suggest arrogance or lack of objectivity in assessing one's own powers.
{sc}self-possession{/sc} implies an ease or coolness under stress that reflects perfect self-control and command of one's powers.

pt.t: answered the insolent question with complete {it}self-possession{/it}

pt: {sc}aplomb{/sc} implies a manifest self-possession in trying or challenging situations.

shortdef: control of one's emotions or reactions especially when under stress : presence of mind, composure
